results.title: Paṭibhāna sutta - Eloquence
results.description: The four types of people found in the world based on the presence or absence of rational and spontaneous eloquence.

results.title: Bhojana sutta - Food
results.description: The giver of food gives five things to the recipients - life, beauty, happiness, strength, and eloquence. They also find happiness as a result of their giving.

results.title: Mahāassapura sutta - The Greater Discourse at Assapura
results.description: The Buddha outlines a progressive training guideline for the bhikkhus to undertake in order to be recognized as ascetics and Brahmins. The Buddha also describes the abandonment of the five hindrances,

results.title: Padhāna sutta - Striving
results.description: The Buddha describes the four right strivings concisely and precisely.

results.title: Parihāna sutta - Decline
results.description: The Buddha describes three things that lead to the decline of a trainee bhikkhu and three things that lead to non-decline.
